review: I was prescribed Bactrim after two other antibiotics failed to cure my UTI, and let me tell you, not only it did not work, but I also had a violent allergic reaction to it.I was suffering from my first UTI (first from many to come sadly). The symptoms went away pretty quickly after taking the first pill but came back after I stopped to take the medicine two days later. From what I remember I got really sick: chills, high fever, nausea, complete loss of appetite, extreme fatigue, and red patches all over my body but especially on my arms/ legs and chest. I had swollen lips for first indication but as I was young I didn’t understand it at first. When I went back to the doctor, he said it was a pretty powerful medicine and that he knew beforehand that a risk of allergy was higher than other medicines. I don’t hold it against him though, it was very frustrating not to find anything that would work to cure this UTI.
Worst side effects ever. I had to take this for a week and it didn't help my UTI at all. Now, I have to get another antibiotic since this one failed.

I was given Bactrim to treat a urinary tract infection. After 2 days of being on the drug I started to develop hives all over my body. Even on the soles of feet and palms of my hands. The itching is so horrible. I went to urgent care and they prescribed a steroid and hydroxyzine for the itching. Prior to this I had no allergies whatsoever not even seasonal allergies. I would ask for an antibiotic that does not contain sulfacetamide.  I also read the reviews here and wasn't worried because I never had any problems

I felt mild relief in the like 3 days but after that my symptoms started coming back! I had severe panic attacks induced by strange thoughts, mild kidney twitches, just overall my body did not respond well to this medication, I was back at the urgent care after taking 2 pill/ day for 7 days

I've been taking bactrim since Friday it's now Sunday. My doctor told me it's a urinary tract infection but only symptoms I'm having is the urge to pee with little urine. Vaginal itching that comes and go with discharge. I'm ready to stop the medicine but I know I can't. I've missed two doses because the side effects are me feeling dizzy feeling nausea a bad headache and lost of appetite.  I don't know what to do I feel like if I stop taking it for a possible UTI it won't go away . But I don't feel it's a UTI cuz I'm not having burning when I pee only after I pee I have itchy feeling that I want to scratch with tissue but I know I can't do that either. I really need help and I hope someone see this that can give me honest answers .. I've been to the health unit and two hospitals they've all gave different results ..

Had a three day course for UTI. NO reaction at all After one pill and a good night's sleep I felt a whole lot better. I don't like taking drugs and frequently have very strange side effects. NOT with this one. It only helped.

I’m on day 2 of using this medication and I cannot finish it. The first time I took it was so weak, dizzy, confused and my heart rate was through the roof. Even going up the stairs or getting up out of bed winded me and I’m completely healthy. It was so bad I’d sleep all day just hoping the symptoms would go away but I can’t take the side effects the rapid heart beat and feeling of constant anxiety. I have never felt this weak from medication. Also it has given me a pounding aura headache that just makes me extremely dizzy and exhausted I’m stopping this medication immediately and contacting my doctor this is horrible. No one should ever experience this. Uti discomfort has subsided mildly but either way I will not continue this awful medication.
This antibiotic works quickly to get rid of UTI but my main side effects are stomach pains and loss of appetite, I have one more dose to take and then I’m finish thank god. I’m taking the 800mg

While I understand that people who do not have many side effects from meds may think it's a mind over matter thing... some people do experience adverse effects that are seemingly unbearable. I am now myself on Bactrim.  Fatigued, depressed, irritable and having nightmares.  These side effects haven't gone away even with the best probiotics.  I still have another week to go and so I basically have to just suck it up and do the best I can.  However, to those of you who can't relate to those of us who have side effects that aren't related to the infection ... please try to be more understanding!  Thank you.

I've had Bactrim three years ago for a UTI too, never had any side effects, I've tried it this week again and for the same reason because I didn't wanted to try macrobid  as I had a bad experience, but not even close to what this stuff did to me. As soon I took the drug my vagina started to itch so bad, I thought it was a yeast infection or something, then my vagina got so swollen I couldn't explain. I took only two doses and stopped, next day I was in horrible pain went to three drs to finally get a gyno to checked me he was horrified said I had a wound in my vulva, gave me some stuff that is finally giving me relief, also got my tongue so sore I can't barely eat, and the Drs doesn't care, my scalp is so sensitive I was about to call an ambulance when I got out of the shower my head felt on fire. I'm beyond traumatized after this experience and praying to God I don't have any other problems with this drug.  Could this be a Fixed drug eruption?

I was prescribed 3 days of Bactrim after reacting poorly to Cipro (after only two days) so this is sort of a combo review. I experienced dizziness, weakness and muscle cramps, especially in my hands and feet. The worst of it was a cluster headache episode that was debilitating. I just finished up the three days of Bactrim so I’m hoping these side effects wear off. UTI is cleared. Wouldn’t recommend for a mild UTI.

The pharmacist said to take this 2x/day at the same time each day with food. Do not take on empty stomach or just a glass of water.  I should see results in two days.  I had burning when I pee, and that's a sure sign of start of UTI infection or kidney infection on it's way.   After the first pill, I felt hot, but that's easily doable and just wear cotton clothes.   He also said to keep drinking lots of water when taking this medicine or a kidney stone could develop.  So I  kept drinking lots of water.  It's been two days and I feel a lot better. My PCP prescribed a prescription for 7 days and said to finish it out and I will.

Short and sweet.:I'm a person who suffers from pure OCD, panic attacks, and I'm allergic to all the cillin family. I recommend this medication. Note that everyone is different and not cookie cutter. Not every med is for every body. The only side effects I've had is slight pressure in lower throat, very slight increase in anxiety (but I'm medicated for that), and being overly tired. IDK what's up with the fatigue of it all, but it's a bad fatigue. Unnatural body weakness and feeling of lethargy. I would rate it 10/10 if it weren't for the sleepiness alone. It works though. It works so good!

I have a fairly mild UTI and it has been many years since I last had one. I decided to go on antibiotics to ensure the UTI wouldn’t turn into anything more severe. I have been prescribed Bactrim for 3 days, and instructed to take 1 tablet every 12 hours (total of 6 pills). So far, no noticeable side effects. I am on day 2. I am generally medication compliant and have never experienced any serious reactions from taking medication. I think doing your part and taking care of your body by eating healthy and exercising is helpful while taking any antibiotic, including getting enough sleep. The pill itself is a medium size. Not the smallest but also not big to the point where it is difficult to swallow. I no longer have the urge to pee not do I feel any burning sensation when peeing, so the meds started working quickly! So far so good!
Bactrim has terrible side effects. Why would this drug even be approved with 50 percent of the patients taking it have terrible side effects.

I took Bactrim for a bad UTI. I could notice a difference in 3 hours on my symptoms. Clear in two days. No side effects at all. Took with water and sometimes food. I was scared after reading the reviews and don’t like to take new medications. I would take again if I had to. It cleared my infection quickly and I like the fact that it was a three day dose.

TLDR; This drug CAN be a nightmare. I finally went to the doctor for my mild UTI. Water just wouldn't kick it. After my first dose, I was immediately thankful that I had gotten it. To my surprise, after taking the first dose, it seemed my infection had spread to my bladder. That night was awful bladder spasms and private area burning like fire. Before I took the medication, I only had slight burning with urination. The next day I pushed water like crazy and thought I was getting better. The meds made me speedy. I was in a fog, but was getting things done. I felt very sickly. I thought, again, that it was a good thing I got the antibiotics because my infection must be super severe to make me this ill. That night I got very short of breath and my heart was pounding. I thought I may have caught covid. I tried to sleep. Through the night I was awake with awful thoughts of death and severe anxiety. The next morning woke with my heart pounding and severe anxiety. I felt like death still.

I was prescribed Bactrim DS 2x a day for a UTI that wouldn’t go away after trying to treat it with cranberry. I became horrendously ill after the 2nd pill, muscle aches, muscle weakness, dizziness, rapid heart rate, feeling faint, and feeling like I couldn’t concentrate. Tried calling my dr to ask if I could go down to one pill a day as 2 felt too much, they didn’t call me back until 3 days later because of the weekend. By then I took it upon myself to only take one pill a day and my dr said that was a good decision. With one pill a day the most I felt was a slight headache and slight loss of appetite, but my UTI symptoms continued to get worse so I was put on cipro. Praying the cipro works for me now.

I completely understand how every drug effects every person differently. However, don't let reviews scare you. Understand that your doctor who prescribed this to you understands your condition, pre-existing conditions and believes the benefits far out weight the negatives. Make sure to read the details before taking it.  I have IBS, I have always dealt with stomach issues. I have been prescribed this multiple times. Every single time I have absolutely no negative side effects. Take it with food no matter what.

This stuff should be taken off the market! I took this for a UTI. As soon as it got in my system good, I began to feel fatigued and nauseated. Stomach cramps got worse and I just generally did not feel well. Actually I felt worse than I did with the UTI! After 4 days on it, I developed achy joints (particularly my knees), and the nausea was unbearable. My eyes felt completely dilated and I just felt like I was overdosing on this stuff. My kidney's even started hurting! And yes, I know to take antibiotics with food ( I made the mistake of not doing so once, never again!). I stopped taking it and went back to the doctor who also recommended me to stop taking Bactrim. The dosage was the generic 800/160 2X a day. I think this is WAY too strong a dosage for some people and doctors need to stop just prescribing this stuff without taking into account what each individual person's body may be able to handle.

Started taking Bactrim for a severe UTI. I try to heal my body naturally, in this case I tried 100% cranberry juice along with D mannatose and a probiotic before seeing a dr. Sometimes medicine is just necessary. But with that being said my body is not used to meds at all. To my surprise, the side effects have been bearable. It took about 2 doses (1 full day) to feel relief. Pretty quick in my opinion. I will say I’m extremely fatigued. I’ve been taking naps daily that’s how tired I feel. I’ve also become extremely constipated. That’s probably the worst side effect I’m dealing with but I’m hoping it subsides as I just finished my last dose this morning. Otherwise, not too bad!

I stopped taking Bactrim after 3 days because I have never experienced such joint pain in my life. I was up most of the night in excruciating pain, and when I could fall asleep I had vivid nightmares. I also started getting heaviness in my chest. Worst experience I’ve ever had on a medication also made my skin feel weird. I was prescribed this for a UTI by the 2nd day I was having a harder time going to the bathroom than before I started taking this medication. Prescription was 2x a day for 7 days

It cured my UTI! Did give some fatigue, bloating, headache, bad taste in mouth, insomnia/night anxiety???? Random, I know. I stayed up until 4 am almost every night I took it, but hey, it beats a UTI. Thank goodness I don’t deal with them often. On last day (of 5) I did get some heartburn but I also wasn’t eating much and my diet was weird so it could be unrelated. You never know what works for your body!

I was prescribed Bactrim DS 1 pill 2x a day for 10 days for a UTI. Previously a 5 day course of amoxicillin failed to rid my UTI. I don't think I started to feel better until day 7 but even though I'm now done with the course I still have slight UTI symptoms and test strips still show slight traces. I'm guessing I have a resistant strain of bacteria so I'm going to call my doctor for yet a 3rd antibiotic (I'm guessing Cipro will be next). Overall I did not have any scary symptoms. No upset stomach, no rashes or hives, no headaches. I usually ate a small snack beforehand but always drank a full glass of water with each dose (and tried to drink more through the day as well as recommended). I did my best to stay indoor and wear sunscreen too. I will say on the 7th day I did feel like the skin on my arms were a little sensitive and itchy. Like maybe the start of a rash but it's possible my seasonal allergies were kicking in (I avoided taking Claritin since I didn't know if I could).
Let's start with the intense headache, such a bad headache, nausea, panic attacks I wouldn't recommend this to anybody this is the worst feeling I've had in a long time

Several years ago I was prescribed a twice a day for seven days dose for UTI. After 3 days, I was in ICU fighting for my life due to severe reaction to Bactrim. Started as severe body aches and vomiting, by day 3 was admitted to ICU for anaphylactic shock. Recently, I was prescribed a different antibiotic(unfortunately can't recall name) for a tooth infection. After 3 days I was so very sick, I thought I was dying. I literally thought I had Covid. A voice whispered "antibiotic", I looked up ingredients and it too was a sulfa based drug. Stopped taking medication and within a day, I was much better, thank God! So, based on my experience with Bactrim and other sulfa based drugs, I would rate it 1 due to my severe allergy. But it did do a fantastic job of clearing up the UTI! I now have Bactrim and drugs like it listed as #1 allergy on medical records.

I started with Keflex for a UTI and after finishing the entire dose, I started having symptoms again after a week.I was then prescribed Bactrim.I had a full blown panic attack after the 3rd and 4th dose.After the last dose my BP was 174/120.I took a Valium and eventually it went down.I threw the remaining 2 pills in the trash.It did get rid of the symptoms but the side effects were terrible.

A doctor sent me this antibiotic because I have often UTI's and this would be the 4th that they try. This antibiotic makes me feel extremely weird, it gives me anxiety and makes me depressed, it also makes me extremely tired, like high and mentally disabled. I feel like this each time after I take it. It’s a very strange medication. I have issues with pernicious anemia as well, and seems like this med makes it 3x worse.I quit.

I'm on my 3rd day and have not had any side effects whatsoever. I took a urine test and the infection is almost gone.  I ate normal meals and reduced my sugar intake.  I drank a lot of water.  I'm a bit irritable,  but its because I haven't had a cup of coffee in 2 very long weeks.

Irregular heartbeats that "feel" like a panic attack. Weak feeling all over body and loss of strength after doing something simple such as throwing out the trash. Bactrim MAY give you brain fog and feelings of depersonalization-it may also affect your electrolyte levels. Be prepared for possible psychotic effects on your brain and not knowing why you are losing yourself/mind. More importantly, watch for the development of pernicious anemia. Again, this may not happen to EVERYONE but watch yourself carefully while on this drug. This won't cure EVERY UTI. Before you take this, BEG your doctor to CULTURE your urine so that you will be put on the "right" antibiotics. This interferes with your body's ability to breakdown Folate into a useable form and can interfere with your bone marrow WHICH produces red blood cells.

Started bactrim for a UTI and within hours had sores all inside my mouth. Didn’t think anything of it. Then the next time I got a UTI and was prescribed bactrim got  sores all over my mouth again. Finally realizing my it is a side effect of the med.

Gave me severe anxiety, I felt like I was psychotic. Panic attack where I could barely even talk, eyes were bugging out. I am not a mentally ill person in any way and I have never felt this way before in my life the way this pill made me feel. I almost didn’t know it was the drug until I checked this website and read that everyone and their mothers have experienced severe anxiety caused by this pill. Doctor told me it doesn’t cause anxiety to continue taking it today so it looks like I won’t be listening to them after reading a web page full of people with complaints of severe anxiety and panic. I also definitely felt like I was losing myself/my mind without knowing why as someone has mentioned on here before. It’s tricky because physically I have not had issues with this pill I was not sick from it so I thought everything was going well, but it really messed with my brain. Do not take this.

After reading about possible side effects and reading all of the negative reviews for Bactrim, I was scared to take it after the Macrobid failed to cure my UTI. After 7 days of taking Augmentin, which also failed to work and gave me diarrhea, I braced myself and took the Bactrim. I want to report that I had no side effects at all, and it cleared up my infection. I would advise anyone prescribe this drug for a UTI to go ahead and take it, and don’t drive yourself crazy with worry like I did.

I’m taking 160 mg every 12 hours for a UTI. And I took my seventh pill this morning. The first day I took it I felt completely fine no side effects at all, next morning I woke up and felt horrible, my back where my kidneys are hurt bad, I had a severe cramp where my liver sits underneath my right rib cage to the point I couldn’t even manage to walk around. I felt sick to my stomach, dizzy, just plain horrible. I went to the hospital thinking my liver was failing on me, everything checked out fine. At first I didn’t know it was the medication doing this so I continued to take it. I laid in my bed for three days straight. And today I honestly feel like I’m going to die, it’s making me feel very detached from reality, I feel like I’m going to throw up every where, my head is pounding , I feel tired but can’t sleep. I am 27 years old and have been healthy up to this point NO HEALTH PROBLEMS. I'm stopping this medication and I'm hoping I’ll feel better in a couple days.

I have to share my positive experience here for others. I switched to this medicine after a really bad experience with macrobid and I’m very glad I did. I have had zero side effects and the pill is doing exactly what it’s supposed to! This was a refreshing change from the previous medicine and I hope this helps someone prescribed this.

Male. I was on Humira for 1 year. Month 11 I had first side effect, UTI. E coli got into prostate as it rare for males to get UTI. The immune system was not stopping it. Took cipro week 1 & 2 followed by bactrim 2 weeks low dose.  It works.  Caution  ..My hair thinned like big time. Been off all antibiotics now and quit humira.  Be careful of side effects. Some are not listed.  Good news, hair loss will grow back

Avoid at all costs!! I read the reviews and was pretty nervous to try it. Well the bad reviews were right. I was really hoping I would be one of the people with a good experience of this drug. That was sadly not the case. I took ONE pill and within 3 hours I had an extremely high heart rate, was very shaky, very lightheaded, and had shortness of breath. I ended up having to go to the ER to get the bactrim flushed out my system. I’m probably allergic to it, but it’s concerning how many other people have had bad results. Please if you have another option, take the other option. From my experience, I would only take this as a last resort. I that hope your experience with bactrim goes better than mine did.

I had the worst experience with Bactrim. The first day I had a 101.8 fever, chills, uncontrollable shaking, anxiety, rash, and fast heartbeat. The next day I was extremely achy nauseous and could not eat anything the whole day. I stopped taking it after the second day and my symptoms are getting better after a day but still feel cruddy and have a bad headache.

Let me tell you, I was so nervous to start Bactrim after reading these reviews. I thought for sure I was going to have terrible side effects. Turns out, I’m completely fine. The most I’ve had is some nausea/lack of appetite but I get that with almost all antibiotics. Make sure you eat a meal ahead of taking each pill and drink lots of water. As long as you’re not allergic to sulfa drugs, I can almost guarantee that you’re going to be ok :). Remember, temporary side effects are better than a kidney infection!!

UTI - Bactrim for 7 days. Day 1 stomach discomfort. Day 2 UTI slight urgency but manageable- that night had anxiety attack and heart palpitations. By day 4 exhausted, hardly able to do my daily work. I called my dr on day 5 and she said this is normal - to just power through and since I’m allergic to penicillin I’m likely not allergic to Sulfa. That night had chills and a 100 degree fever. Day 6 I felt even worse (chills and fever) and developed hives. Was told I have a Sulfa allergy and to stop with the meds and start Macrobid. The next day with Bactrim leaving my system I developed a full body rash that made me look sunburned and had a 103 degree fever. The rash subsided 6 days after it started and my other symptoms ended 3 days after I stopped the pills. Overall, one of the worst medical experiences of my adult life. Macrobid seemed to work- only symptom was head fog which may have been from Bactrim. Giving Bactrim 2 stars because it seemed to clear the UTI.

Was prescribed a 7 day treatment for a UTI. Day 1: started feeling very weak & excruciating leg pain. Day 2: started experiencing severe flu-like symptoms and could not move my neck, eat or drink anything, and could barely lift my head off my pillow. I literally felt like life was over Day 3: admitted to ICU fighting for my life! Never will I EVER take this medication  or any sulfa containing medications. This drug should be banned! I should add that my UTI was cured, probably on the first day.

I’m a healthy 24 year old woman! I was prescribed Macrobid at first which gave me terrible muscle spasms and puking, I decided to go back to the urgent care and was switched to Bactrim. WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE! The first few days were fine but around the 4th day my throat was closing and I’m broken out in hives everywhere! My face is so so swollen and my fever is 103, I’m currently on steroids to try to get rid of the allergic reaction. Awful experience, this medication should be banned.

Day 1: Prescribed 1 pill twice a day for 7 days. The medication seemed to be working and I was urinating like normal. Day 2: That night, I ended up experiencing terrible pain on the inside and outside of my vagina such as: burning, itching, redness and swelling. I thought it could be a reaction but it wasn’t sure. Day 3: That morning, I ended up experiencing the same terrible pain but it was more severe. At this point, I could hardly move, sit or stand without it hurting. It felt like ulcers on the inside and outside of my vagina due to the terrible burning sensation. That night, the pain got even worse. I ended up having chills and body aches, possibly a low grade fever. Day 4: I stopped taking the medication. I decided that this medication is not worth the symptoms and advised to my doctor that I would not be continuing the medication.*If I could rate my symptoms on a scale from 1-10, I would rate it at a 15. I will NEVER take this medication again.

Started Bactrim 800mg DS on a Wednesday. Thursday afternoon had a 103 fever. Fever would reduce with NSAIDS. Fever has been present every day since. The major side effects I experienced were fever, chills, body aches, cough, loss of appetite, feeling dehydrated, severe fatigue, change in urine volume. I thought maybe I had Covid, got a test. (No covid.)  Original UTI symptoms (kidney area pain) was gone by day 3. I’m on the last day of the script & I will NOT take this again.

No no no!! I’m almost through with the 10 days of taking Bactrim. This medication makes me extremely anxious, panicky and jittery!!! My blood pressure is extremely high as well! And I already have panic/anxiety disorders and high blood pressure! It was literally driving me insane! I would not recommend to anyone who has an anxiety disorder or high blood pressure! It also took forever to work!!!! It's awful. Please research it carefully before taking it. Talk to your doctor!

Hello,Update ..... DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICATION !!!As per my conversation before my tongue was peeling yet it literally blew up.Obviously I was allergic.However, it’s February and my UTI is back .I’m petrified after this experience to take anything!!I was prescribed Cefdinir so we shall see!!Be very cautious with this medication!!Everything seemed fine and then it all went awry within a couple of days!!

I took the full course seemed fine. The next day I was rushed to a hospital 2 1/2 hours away from my town because no hospital in the cities near mine would take me. I had Steven-Johnson’s Syndrome and was in the hospital for a week with severe problems with every mucus membrane on my body.  Also, can’t have MSG and Hydrogenated Soy Protein. There are other antibiotic allergies and sensitivities in my family.

I was prescribed Bactrim 800/160 mg for 5 days, 2 times a day. Day 1 no problem just lost appetite. Day 2 no appetite, kidney pain, hands got shaky and was very anxious. I considered stopping prescription. Day 3 (5th pill) within an hour of taking it my heart rate got up to 176 and I was gasping for air. I called 911 because its just myself and my 2 young children here. Paramedics ruled as a panic attack. Never had this problem so I know its from the medication. Absolutely will never take this again. Im currently still on day 5 so if anything else crazy happens I'll update. I wish these didn't continue releasing medication for 12 hours... The anxious feelings are still coming in waves. Trying to drink a lot of water to flush this poison out of my system.Currently having no more UTI symptoms so I think it cleared the infection. Giving it a 3 because it did what it was supposed to, quickly, but definitely NOT worth the side effects.

I was given a 7 day 2x a day treatment. My UTI symptoms almost immediately improved after first dose. I am now on day 3 and considering stopping early because of the throbbing headache I've had for two days now. I've been chugging water and taken Tylenol and it hasn't dented the pain I feel. I don't mind tolerating pain if it's harmless but I'm worried that I'm causing harm to myself and I keep reading that headaches are one of the more serious side effects. I also feel weak and run down, like holding my arm up for a few seconds tires the muscles. I'm giving 3 stars because I think it's treating my UTI due to my symptoms lessening but UGH, this doesn't feel worth it.

I was prescribed this medication for a UTI, after 1 pill I woke up feeling nauseous, non stop vomiting, bloating, diarrhea, headaches, insomnia, dizziness, weak, loss of appetite, fever, chills. I am currently on day 3 and will not be taking this anymore, I have zero improvements, which is to be expected after only 3 days, I was told to take 2 pills daily for 10 days. I can’t take the extreme side effects and I don’t see why a doctor would prescribe this, with these many horrible side effects. I thought I have a stomach bug or food poisoning, until I decided to look up the side effects and realized it’s the medicine. My kind was 800/160MG TB. I don’t recommend.

I was prescribed Bactrim for 3 days 2x a day. The first two pills were fine except I felt like I had taken NyQuil or pain relievers I was delirious. The second day I felt horrible with throbbing headaches and almost unbearable nausea and body aches as well as a slight fever. Today is day 3 and I don’t even want to take them because I feel so horrible and my mouth is dry and I’m still so so nauseated I can hardly move and the pain is still there, as well as my fever. The last time I took it (may 2020) I only had a headache so IDK why I feel absolutely like death this time. I don’t recommend Bactrim for anyone unless it’s the only option you have left because it’s horrible and I haven’t felt this sick in my life but my UTI is gone

Listen ! No! Heck no! Absolutely NOT!!!I was prescribed macrobid but  itching  started and my face felt numb just after the 2nd dose!!! So my doctor switched me to Bactrim !  I will say the first 2 pills weren’t so bad. Little nausea, slight headache. But baaaabbbby this 3rd pill is the awful! I’m currently shivering as I type this. I’m in a robe and under covers. Make it make sense. Prior to this I had a scare... my heart rate increased so high!!!! Talk about a rapid beating out of no where, I FREAKED oooout!!!! I should’ve read the reviews and listened ! I didn’t listen... thinking I’d have a better outcome. I had 3 pills left. I’m not taking that!! I’ll keep drinking my water and flushing my system because the symptoms were milder than the antibiotic !!!! We all are different indeed but dang how can your body handle this stuff ?  Still shivering by the way. I was given this twice a day for 3 days

Okay here is my story.....I’m 3 days in and after the first dose I felt amazing. Next day even better. Today not so good, I have had sweats at least thrice and stomach pains with burping constantly.My tongue is actually peeling.I have had no appetite throughout the course of 3 days thus far!!!I’m stopping it in fear of something even worse happening!!I can not take my daily runs on this medication. Anxiety is high and my mouth hurts!!!I had sepsis 21 months ago which started with a UTI and several antibiotics do not agree with me!!!I will update as time goes on.Right now I want my mouth to stop hurting!!!I would be very cautious if you are prescribed this medication!!

My anxiety and mental health was under control until I got a mild UTI and was prescribed Bactrim. My heart rate skyrocketed for days, it induced panic attacks, I had no idea what was happening to me until I looked up the reviews and realized I was reacting to the bactrim. My heart rate reached 130 bpm at one point and I went to the doctor to have my heart checked. I took 4 doses and will never take this again. It ruined my life. 2 weeks later I’m still recovering from the anxiety it caused. I am angry this medication was prescribed to me.

honestly not terrible. I was prescribed Bactrim 2 doses/day for 7 days after they prescribed keflex (which didn’t work). A little nausea after the first couple doses, some indigestion, some lower back pain. As long as you drink lots of water with the pill and throughout the day the side effects are pretty mild. I had ginger chews and pepto for stomach issues that worked well. Eat a big meal before you take the pill too. kombucha, yogurt, and probiotics during and after the course will help your stomach heal. I would much prefer this over a kidney infection. If you’re having major side effects from day one, perhaps try something different. Everyone reacts differently!

24yo male. Was prescribed Bactrim for the specific bacterial strain "morganella morganii" - tested at MicrogenDX. First 2 days no improvement at all- which worried me. Doc reassured me to just keep on the program. After day 6 the symptoms reduced significantly. I asked for another week on this just in case I had prostatitis. Kept taking it and symptoms gradually disappeared. However I had some serious reactions on day 10 - whole body rash (aloe helped a lot). Day 12 - Severe fatigue and muscle aches whole body, had to stay in bed most of the day. Stopped after this experience.After taking it for 12 days though, the UTI symptoms were gone. I'm having the worst gastrointestinal problems and I'm only on day 3/7. I have extremely constipated, I have gas and bloating and I have nausea right after I take the pill.

This is definitely my favourite medicine to treat urinary tract infections. I have a longstanding history with UTI's, one even sent me to the ER. The best part about this medicine is that it works quickly and feel relief within the first dose, which is great. I tried nitrofurantin once and absolutely hated it because of side effects & will stick with this. Luckily I've never experienced any negative side effects & I've taken with and without food. No nausea, nothing! It's definitely a hefty sized pill though.

Something really bad happened to me 14 years ago that caused trauma to the urinary tract.  Ever since I have used Bactrim on a regular basis to flush out my bladder and urethra of bacteria because my body does not do a sufficient job through urination. If you take it on an empty stomach, it will make you feel really sick, but the medicine is awesome and I highly recommend it.

It's currently 12:30am, and I'm wide awake on a school night typing this. I didn't exactly have all the symptoms of a urinary tract infection, but always have the urgency to pee. The constant urge to pee pretty much ruins what little social life I have. Having to make constant trips to the bathroom doesn't fit well with football games.

I ended up with a urinary tract infection due to my diabetes.  My PA prescribed Bactrim and I have not experienced any side effects. The burning and urge to urinate, but even after 2 days still feel like the bladder was not emptied. It is day 5 and I noticed some discoloration in urine in the morning hours. I take it that is due to some bleeding.  It went back to clear yellow tonight. I am carefully completing the course of this medication and hope it works for others like it has for me.  I feel great!

Seemed to clear up my infection, but started feeling nauseous the next day.  Steadily got worse each day.  On the fourth day developed a severe headache but slept it off.  Doctor instructed me to stop taking it.  Experienced severely high blood pressure.  Also made my abdominal muscles feel weak

I was prescribed Bactrim and felt worse right away. After reading the side effects, I told myself that what I was feeling was normal. I just started Bactrim. I have noticed a significant change for the better. For those of you that get yeast infections, eat lots of yogurt if you can. I have found this has helped me in the past.

Great for urinary tract infection.
Always works well with no side effects.

It works awesome. If you have problems with this medicine it is probably due to being allergic to it, so stop taking it.

I took Bactrim once for a Urinary Tract infection. I can't remember exactly how many days I was instructed to take the pill, but I know it was over a week. Everything was fine up until the 9th day, then my entire body broke out in hives.

Works great.

Caused joint and tendon pains, made my hand go numb and ruined my tendon in my thumb so it doesn't bend right now and sticks in place.

I'm taking Bactrim twice a day for ten days.  I was taking five day course of Cipro and had a migraine headache, which wouldn't go away.  Cipro didn't even help me, I still had white blood cells and blood in my urine which makes for a bad urinary tract infection. The PA gave me Bactrim. I still have a slight headache but the UTI was so bad, I can deal with these side effects.  The pressure in my bladder area has subsided and five more days to go. I can handle Bactrim.
I took it for 5 days, and it seemed to help, but now 2 days after the last pills I'm in a lot of pain again.  Perhaps it would've been more effective had I been on it a few more days.
Effective, but caused nausea, loss of appetite and migraines.

I get frequent urinary tract infections and was prescribed Bactrim by a doctor at an urgent care center because Macrobid made me pretty nauseous and really tired. It seemed to clear up the infection well but made me extremely sick. I vomited constantly while on Bactrim. I ended up missing four days of school before deciding I couldn't keep taking it and called urgent care for a new prescription. The doctor I talked to when I called said I should never have been prescribed Bactrim because people who don't tolerate Macrobid well usually have even worse side effects while on Bactrim. Since then I have been prescribed Keflex when I get a UTI and have had no side effects at all.

Today was the first day I took this medication. Two hours after, I experienced joint pain, blurred vision, back pain, a headache, chills, fever, nausea, cough and sore throat. This was in addition to my already severe urinary tract infection symptoms which I was sent to the ER for the night before, including, severe pain in pelvis, achy back (kidneys). Although, symptoms of a severe UTI can also be fever, pain in the flank (pain that runs along the back at about waist level), chills, and nausea, I believe the medication gave me the additional symptoms. I was fine all day long until around two hours after taking the pill. After about 3 hours, symptoms increasingly went away. I am not sure if the pills are working or if they wore off.

Took this medicine during Chemo and Radiation.  Did not work, may have been because of the Chemo and Radiation, just not sure.  Was given Cipro and that did not work either.  I am now on my 3rd of 5 day Levaquin dose and passed my AZO UTI over the counter test this morning, yea.  Two months of a UTI is a bit much, although, I now know what works for future.

Was treated for a urinary tract infection but I had no symptoms, so I really don't know if it actually helped. But I ended up with a yeast infection afterwards. Only took it for 3 days.
